Attacked by Trump, Europe wavers between denial and fear of reprisals
subhead: At risk of appearing weak once again, as they did after this summer's trade agreement, leaders of the European Union have opted to ignore the latest accusations from the US administration.

Zelensky's dilemma: To yield or not to yield the Donbas
subhead: The peace plan put forward by the US calls for Ukraine to withdraw its troops from the parts of the Donbas it still controls, in exchange for vague security guarantees after the war. Both Ukraine's political class and society remain fiercely opposed to the proposal.

title: 'Caesar,' photographer who exposed Syria barbarity, wins French-German human rights prize
subhead: A hero of the resistance to Bashar al-Assad's regime, Farid al-Madhan was honored for risking his life to take photographs documenting the widespread torture practiced by the Syrian dictator's regime.

title: Jewels of power go on display in Paris
subhead: Opals and cameos belonging to Empress Josephine, an emerald tiara once worn by Queen Victoria, diamond aigrettes from maharajas:  At the Hôtel de la Marine, the exhibition 'Dynastic Jewels' offers a rare glimpse into the jewelry collections of historical figures.

title: How the Israeli army is razing the part of Gaza it is supposed to withdraw from
subhead: Despite the ceasefire that was declared on October 10, Israel has continued to raze many buildings east of the 'yellow line' in the Gaza Strip, according to local residents and satellite images of the enclave.

Israel's reign of terror over the West Bank
subhead: Deadly shootings by the army, beatings by settlers, devastating raids, arbitrary arrests, torture in prison: The level of violence inflicted on Palestinians living in the territory has never been so high since the Israeli occupation began in 1967.

title: The ultra-rich are claiming an increasing share of global wealth
subhead: The wealth of the ultra-rich is undergoing a historic surge, according to the third report of the World Inequality Lab co-directed by French economist Thomas Piketty. Political choices can reverse these trends, the authors say.

title: 'By appeasing Russia and accommodating China, the Trump administration is carving up the world into spheres of influence'
subhead: Since the release of the US National Security Strategy on December 5, the increasingly harsh tone of the transatlantic relationship has drawn attention, even though this power struggle was not among Donald Trump's main priorities, writes Le Monde columnist Gilles Paris.
